newsitem.title: UK: Low & Bonar warns on 1996 results, buys firm.
newsitem.headline: Low & Bonar warns on 1996 results, buys firm.

text.p: Packaging, plastics and special materials group Low & Bonar Plc warned on Tuesday that its 1996 results will be affected by weaker-than-expected trading conditions at its silage wrap and North Amercian packaging operations.
"While these factors will impinge upon our results for 1996, overall the group still anticipates making some underlying progress over last year," it said in a statement.
The company also announced the acquisition of a Belgian polypropylene fabrics business for 9.0 million stg, which will result in a 2.0 million stg provision for integration costs.
The provision will be charged against full-year profits.

Low & Bonar said that across most of its activities, trading had been broadly in line with expectations, but it added that the silage wrap and packaging operations "have not been as strong as we anticipated earlier in the year".

It added that the acquisition of UCO Technical Fabrics based in Lokeren, Belgium, and of the affiliated UCO Ostend Netting "significantly increases Low & Bonar's presence in the polypropylene fabrics market" and provided scope for efficiency savings across its four existing polypropylene businesses.
